CatDescriptText: Van O'Kelley, welfare caseworker, 5112 Lakeside Road, Forest Hills, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Yes, and the reason for my opinion is that the section will be a nice part of town for businesses. It is close to downtown and favorable not only to the Negro but to all others.  A lot of people from out-of-town will be coming to that section to shop."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Van O'Kelley wearing coat and dark striped necktie, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower store window in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
